Post Description:
We are celebrating Chinese New Year under strict but necessary safety measures. Our COVID-19 situation is stable, but please stay vigilant to prevent new outbreaks.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
It has been a difficult year, and the comfort and support of families and friends have helped us to get through these trying times.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
The Year of the Ox brings new hope. Our national vaccination programme is progressing. Please take the vaccine when your turn comes ‚Äì both for yourself, and  your loved ones too.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Let us also give heartfelt thanks to the essential workers keeping Singapore going through the festive period, as well as our Malay, Indian and Eurasian friends who will be covering for their Chinese colleagues.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
You can read my Chinese New Year Message 2021 (in English and Mandarin) on the PMO website at go.gov.sg/cny2021pm. I wish all Singaporeans good health, and a very happy Chinese New Year. ‚Äì LHL‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä

(MCI Photo by Terence Tan)
Comments: Happy Lunar New Year to you n your family. Stay healthy sir‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Post Description:
The recent community cases remind us that the war against COVID-19 is far from over. With Chinese New Year coming up, we have decided to tighten up to keep everyone safe.

These stricter measures will surely disappoint all of us looking forward to celebrating CNY. But just look at the countries near and far experiencing repeated surges in cases, and you will see why we need to stay vigilant.

It‚Äôs exactly 1 year since our first confirmed COVID-19 case in Singapore. The year has gone by at breakneck pace, as we all struggled to cope with the unprecedented chaos and disruption to our lives. Through immense effort and sacrifice, we‚Äôve got ourselves to a stable situation. Our vaccination programme is underway, with  seniors starting to get their shots next week.

Let us continue to protect ourselves and our loved ones by adhering to all the measures. ‚Äì LHL

(@straits_times Infographic)
Comments: Muslims who could not invite anyone last year: First Time?

(@straits_times Infographic)
Comments: I‚Äôm a resident in Chinatown and both my parents working in the hawker of Chinatown Complex. For the past week, the crowd in Chinatown has been increasing by a lot. Happy that the sales for my parents stall increased. However, wishes that the safety measurement become better. From my observation only 20% of the visitor scan in to visit the hawker and there is no temperature taken. Although it will be a hassle as a resident who stays there as I walk up and down and around at least 4 times a day. But for the health benefit of the people staying and working there and also everyone please improve the measurement. Not to mention a lot elderly stay there. I can stay at home but my parents have to work so they need to be out.Thank you for providing free covid testing for people who work at Chinatown. But this method can only help to spot the virus and prevent it from spreading. How about stopping them to reach the owners? Although we all know temperature taking doesn't mean anything but it better than nothing. Please look into it!Thanks for all the hard work. üòç

Post Description:
Met @kohpohkoon and several Yio Chu Kang grassroots leaders this morning. With the new electoral boundaries, Teck Ghee will be taking over part of Yio Chu Kang, while the rest will become a separate single member constituency. I had originally planned a walkabout today to visit markets and meet residents, but unfortunately had to postpone it to comply with safe distancing measures.

And so we kept to a small group, and discussed residents‚Äô concerns and other issues while maintaining an arms-length distance from one another.

I got home to learn the sad news that another COVID-19 patient had passed away. My deepest sympathies to the family.

Keeping a safe physical distance apart should not mean social isolation. Give your friends and family a call, and continue supporting one another during this period. ‚Äì LHL 
#SGUnited (Photo by Lee Jia Wen)
Comments: rilly I miss you Singapore

Post Description:
Visited Teck Ghee Block 341 Market and a few families in Teck Ghee this morning, to see how everyone is coping. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
People were going about their activities, but making an effort to keep a safe distance. We are not quite there yet ‚Äì it was a peak time for the market, and it was more crowded than we would like to see. But people were conscious of COVID-19. Nearly everyone remembered not to offer to shake hands. A few wore masks, perhaps because they were not well.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
The pandemic is escalating rapidly around the world. Our own situation here is under control, but we are seeing quite a few new cases among Singaporeans and residents returning from abroad. There is a significant risk that they may infect others and start new clusters. We must do our utmost to prevent this. That is why returnees are being issued stay-home notices. If you are a returnee, please observe the notice strictly to protect others, and help us fight COVID-19. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
In these volatile times, everyone needs to remain vigilant and socially responsible, and adhere to all measures in place to keep Singapore safe. If we all do our part, we can ride out this storm together. ‚Äî LHL‚†Ä
‚†Ä
#SGUnited‚†Ä
#SingaporeTogether‚†Ä
‚†Ä
([1,6] Photos by me, [2,7,8,9] MCI Photos by LH Goh, [3,4,5] MCI Photos by Zinkie Aw)
Comments: lol its just coronavirus. Pretty sure we will get through this.

Everyone need to keep safe distance. Even for the hawker. If this is the measure, that not standardise for all safe mark which keep encourage people to do so.

Post Description:
Visited Teck Ghee Block 341 Market and a few families in Teck Ghee this morning, to see how everyone is coping. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
People were going about their activities, but making an effort to keep a safe distance. We are not quite there yet ‚Äì it was a peak time for the market, and it was more crowded than we would like to see. But people were conscious of COVID-19. Nearly everyone remembered not to offer to shake hands. A few wore masks, perhaps because they were not well.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
The pandemic is escalating rapidly around the world. Our own situation here is under control, but we are seeing quite a few new cases among Singaporeans and residents returning from abroad. There is a significant risk that they may infect others and start new clusters. We must do our utmost to prevent this. That is why returnees are being issued stay-home notices. If you are a returnee, please observe the notice strictly to protect others, and help us fight COVID-19. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
In these volatile times, everyone needs to remain vigilant and socially responsible, and adhere to all measures in place to keep Singapore safe. If we all do our part, we can ride out this storm together. ‚Äî LHL‚†Ä
‚†Ä
#SGUnited‚†Ä
#SingaporeTogether‚†Ä
‚†Ä
([1,6] Photos by me, [2,7,8,9] MCI Photos by LH Goh, [3,4,5] MCI Photos by Zinkie Aw)

Post Description:
It is five weeks since I spoke about the COVID-19 situation in Singapore. So it is timely to update Singaporeans again on the medical, economic and psychological outlooks of the situation.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Today, the @WHO officially declared the COVID-19 outbreak a pandemic. This means that while the situation in Singapore remains under control, the COVID-19 threat will be with us for a long time. We cannot be complacent.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
There are some baseline precautions we must get used to, like maintaining good personal hygiene and not holding large gatherings. We must also plan ahead in case a major outbreak happens in Singapore, like in South Korea or Italy.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
If a major outbreak happens, we will need more stringent social distancing measures, such as suspending schools and compulsory telecommuting. These will slow down the rate of transmission and prevent our healthcare system from being overwhelmed.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Already our economy has been seriously impacted, so we are working on a second stimulus package to support businesses and workers.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Singapore‚Äôs response to COVID-19 has been recognised by WHO and the international community. This is through the efforts of many Singaporeans, from the frontline staff to all of us keeping #SGclean. I thank all Singaporeans who are dealing with this calmly and responsibly. We must keep up our efforts, and remain #SGUnited.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
You can watch my address in English, Malay and Chinese on the PMO YouTube channel (click on the link in my bio). ‚Äì LHL
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
(MCI Photo by Lee Jia Wen)‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Comments: It's Affecting Jobs too, n till now I couldn't Find a Suitable Full time F&B Services industry job too.....
